data.title: Beer
data.text: We stopped in for a quick happy hour. They had a pretty good selection of beers...we could all find something to quench our thirst. :)

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello s t - thanks for stopping by the Biergarten.  Although our season is almost over, we have a few more days that we hope you will join us for!  Thanks!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice place, informal
data.text:
Let me start by saying I live in Virginia Beach so I'm used to slightly warmer temperatures.  It was super windy the night I went up there so that was the sole source of my discomfort.

I love the informal environment and the hefeweizen they have on tap is phenomenal!

BEWARE: the menu states "giant pretzel"...they are not kidding!  It was literally a pretzel the size of a pizza!  A group of guys sat down just after mine arrived and were admiring it so I cut mine in half and sent the rest down to them!  They really seemed to enjoy it and I thought it was decent but not the best pretzel I've ever had.

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Nicole!  Thank you for also joining us at The Biergarten!  I hope you can join us for Oktoberfest on Sunday, Oct 2!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great city views from the top of Hotel Monaco!
data.text: Roof-top venue.  Good food.  Beautiful city views, relaxing environment during our stay at Hotel Monaco Pittsburgh.

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi 50StateGoal-
Thank you for joining us!  Hope to see you again before the end of the season!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: GREAT!
data.text:
I met up with family at the Biergarten for drinks and it was a great experience.

Friendly staff, great location and yummy menu items and drinks were to be had.

I had a Wyndridge Dry Hop Apricot Cider (my first) and it was delicious – I had several LOL

I ordered the pickle plate, the cheddar board, the fried pickles and several orders of the rosemary maple glazed nuts.

The food was great – all very tasty and well prepared and presented.

The only downside was that the curry wurst wasn’t available but it didn’t stop us from having a great afternoon of food and drinks.

Highly recommend – especially if staying at the Hotel Monaco as I was!

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Patrick C!
Glad to hear you enjoyed!  Thanks for dropping by and hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Biergarten
data.text:
This Biergarten located on the top (ninth) floor of the Monaco Hotel offers a nice unpretentious seating area. Not much view as it obstructed by the adjacent buildings.
It offers a variety of draft and bottled beer. It was served cold and it really hit the spot on a warn night. The Bratwurst was quite good.
The service was excellent.

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi TorontoMusicman!  Thanks for joining us!  Hope that you will be back again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good happy hour spot
data.text: Good beer selection and happy hour eats. Had the cheese plate and my husband got the giant pretzel. It was indeed huge, and yummy. Met some nice people. Mostly a 30-something crowd on the Friday evening we went. Felt underdressed in shorts and a tee shirt, I guess everyone came from work at companies that do not have casual Friday. Waitstaff was very nice.

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello jehd2010- thanks for joining us!  Please don't ever feel underdressed!  The Biergarten is casual, however, due to events that are in the hotel, sometimes our guests will join us in suits or even ball gowns and tuxedos before a wedding!  But we encourage everyone to join us and be comfortable in whatever attire they may be wearing - you certainly know when it is a game day around here too!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Beautiful setting
data.text: Great place to sit and have some drinks with friends.  They have a full bar so it is not just for the beer lover.  They also offer a small food menu.  Seating is definitely tough to find on a weekend.  It is located at the top of the trendy Hotel Monaco which also offers a great inside bar/restaurant.  Definitely worth stopping by.

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi!  Thanks for stopping!  Yep- we have tons of beers, but also the full bar and awesome cocktails- a little of everything for everyone!  If you run into a crowd, feel free to join us at The Commoner bar while you wait for a seat in the Biergarten as well!  Thanks!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great selection and service!
data.text: loved the food bites and beer selection! The ambiance feels like a NYC experience and the place couldn't be kept any more clean.

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Rex21GT- thanks for joining us!  Don't forget about our Oktoberfest event on October 2- hope to see you then!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Rooftop fun!
data.text: What a cool place!  Rooftop dining in the middle of the city, with giant Jenga and Connect Four games!  The menu is limited, but the beer selection is extensive.  Try the giant pretzel, it's delicious.  We were there on a Wednesday, so there was an after-work crowd, along with some pre-concert folks.  Seating is probably pretty tight on the weekends or right after work. You don't have to stay at the Hotel Monaco to visit the Biergarten (you should stay if you can though, it's awesome).  Definitely worth a stop in the summer.

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello CMSB825!  Thanks for joining us!  Yes, we looove the pretzel up there!  And especially the beer cheese that coms with!  If you run into a crowd and tight space, we welcome you at The Commoner for a drink while you wait as well!  See you soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Awesome ambiance
data.text: It was a cool Spring evening and we arrived around 9:30 p.m. and the place was vibrant with energy. We thoroughly enjoyed the drink selection and it was a great introduction to Pittsburgh on our first night of our first visit to the city!

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for joining us!  We hope that you will come and see us again soon!  Thanks!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: July 4th
data.text: Enjoyed the lovely early evening on the rooftop where the biergarten staff prepared the July 4th "cook aut"  serving German cuisine  and a great selection of craft beers. We also enjoyed the various games, id the oversized jenga and other games too.

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Jamie15401!  Thanks for joining us on your holiday weekend!  See you soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Local Happy Hour.
data.text:
Great place! You are going to find some really good beer, welcoming staff and the scenery is fun too. Just a great atmosphere with community tables where locals and guests of the hotel can enjoy a nice afternoon. 
Will certainly be back, maybe not for happy hour as I was not aware of any deals and it can get packed. So get there early, get a seat, and enjoy!

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Kellenlieb-  Thanks for joining us at The Biergarten!  Hope you join us again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great for a break
data.text: Not much of a view, but still pleasant escape. Great beer list.  cheese plate was excellent. Definitely worth the trip up to sit in the shade and sip a beer on a hot day

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Steve L- thanks for stopping by!  We hope you come by again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Rooftop of the Monaco Hotel
data.text: This is a simple rooftop gathering area, but we had a great time.  They have a limited, but very adequate menu of bar type fare- appetizers, hotdogs, etc

data.title: NIce outdoor experience.
data.text: This beer garden is a casual area with some activities which make it kind of fun. It is a nice fresh area for having a snack and a drink outside and has a comfortable and casual atmosphere. We were there during the Stanley Cup so the large TV screens were the focus for everyone.

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello!  Thank you for joining us!  See you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great spot to watch the Stanley Cup
data.text: Amazing choice of beer and good hot dogs. Sadly shut at 10pm which seemed a bad day to do it, given the Stanley Cup was on. The beer list is truly endless and the atmosphere was great.

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Oakmontfan!  Thanks for stopping by the Biergarten!  See you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Love at 9th Floor
data.text: This is an awesome hangout place at the weekends. The location gives a view of the streets underneath with tall buildings all around. If the weather is not good this place is closed. The gentry pouring in is extremely awesome.

data.title: So glad they opened this place up!
data.text: Awesome views of the city, great service levels and good menu selections.  Located on the rooftop of the Monaco Pittsburgh, if in town, you have to try it out!

data.title: Cozy place for a nice evening
data.text: Small, cozy place on the rooftop. Fried pickles worse to try. Chocolate bier was very sweet, but tasty! Recommend for a nice evening with friends or significant other.

data.title: French Dip and German Bier!
data.text: Long and short I was spending a night at the Monaco with my wife and had yet to experience the Biergarten on the 9th Floor. Timing being everything I arrived just as they were closing early due to rain around 6PM. In any other place this could have lead to disappointment. Where those on duty simply said they were closed. Not here. The employee at the door leading to the roof top (forgot your name and you were great) invited us to come in anyways and ask the servers all the same. If they had not broken everything down I may get that coveted French Dip. Thankfully they were still breaking things down and were happy to get me a beer and that French Dip. Which, by the way, is awesome. Great beef, bread, seasoning and that beer au jus! The priority was the guest and I felt it the entire time. Thank you!

owner_response.author: , Director of Food and Beverage at Biergarten, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello CSwogger!  Thank you for joining us!  We hope you are in town again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
